channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report I-2024020072
item.description:
Report I-2024020072

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-19
  • City: Niles
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: N&M TRANSFER
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While off-loading at the terminal, one Ieaking tote was discovered inside of the trailer. An estimated half a gallon of free product was released. The trailer was isolated pending cleanup. Environmental Restoration LLC(ERLLC) was dispatched to perform the cleanup. ERLLC arrived and inspected the Ieaking tote. ERLLC discovered a small hole in the top of the tote. ERLLC deplyoed absorbent material as needed. ERLLC transferred the product into a new tote. The waste and damaged tote were placed into a yard bag and left on the trailer for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024021223
item.description:
Report X-2024021223

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: LAKE ORION
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: First noticed by a package handler on the conveyor belt due to the smell. QA was called and removed package and put in bag lined red hazmit bin. There was leakage on the belt. Leakage was tested and cleaned up with absorbent pads. DescribePack: The bottles of Part B have a small hole in the cap. The safety seal on one of the bottles was punctured or burst and the liquid was able to leak out of the hole in the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put in a plastic lined red hazmat bin and the residue on the belt was tested as negative.

item.title: Report E-2024020452
item.description:
Report E-2024020452

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-01
  • City: Jackson
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: US ECOLOGY TRANSPORTATION SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While loading 275-gallon IBC container into a trailer, a small piece of damaged metal from the trailer wall punctured the container. The forklift operator immediately transferred the damaged tote to a containment area. The leakage was contained within the truck and secondary containment trench and did not impact the environment. Chemetall utilized their in-house resources to neutralize, clean up and properly manage the spilled material.

item.title: Report X-2024020976
item.description:
Report X-2024020976

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-07
  • City: SAGINAW
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This was a package in a hazmat tote at QA2 upon arrival. The containers inside had loose caps. The hazmat tote was taken to the hazmat cage until it could be processed after the sort. DescribePack: The 2 containers inside had loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: This was a package in a hazmat tote at QA2 upon arrival. The containers inside had loose caps. The hazmat tote was taken to the hazmat cage until it could be processed after the sort.

item.title: Report X-2024020997
item.description:
Report X-2024020997

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: PORTAGE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was placed on IC rollers. More packages were placed behind hazmat package and eventually it was pushed off and fell onto the floor. After discovering the package it was placed into a hazmat leaker tote and the spill was cleaned up per the SDS. DescribePack: The caps of two of the bottles burst open after impacting the ground. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in leaker tote to prevent further leaking and spill was cleaned up per the SDS.

item.title: Report X-2024020633
item.description:
Report X-2024020633

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: SAGINAW
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in the unload and was wet in the one corner and had an odor. Proper PPE was used to remove the package and placed in a HazMat bin. Upon inspection we found that one of the bottles had a crack that caused the leakage. We are unsure if the other bottles were leaking. DescribePack: Upon inspection we found that one of the bottles had a crack that caused the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Proper PPE was used to remove the package and placed in a HazMat bin.

item.title: Report X-2024020631
item.description:
Report X-2024020631

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WET REG. HAZMAT BOX WAS FOUND DURING THE UNLOAD AND BROUGHT OVER FOR INSPECTION. UPON INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND TO BE A DAMAGED HAZMAT AND THE HAZMAT PROCESS WAS STARTED. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING FROM THE CAP AREA BUT THE CAP IS PROPERLY THREADED AND TIGHT, REASON UNKNOWN. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: BOX WAS TURNED RIGHT SIDE UP ACCORDING TO THE DIRECTIONAL ARROWS PRINTED ON THE BOX.
